title: Eva Longoria displays her stellar sense of style as she departs Annabel's in London
text:
She recently turned heads with her stylish display at Paris Fashion Week.

And Eva Longoria cut a glamorous figure as she departed Annabel's after a night out in London on Tuesday.

The actress, 44, looked nothing short of sensational as she left the private members' club, donning a cream knee-length coat with a white turtle-neck jumper.

Style: Eva Longoria, 44, cut a glamorous figure as she departed Annabel's after a night out in London on Tuesday

She also sported tan suede, slim-fitting trousers and added height to her frame with a a pair of dark heels.

Styling her brunette locks into loose waves, the Desperate Housewives star completed her look for the evening with a black clutch bag.

Eva informed her social media followers she was in London earlier on Tuesday with a blurred snap she posted on Instagram wearing an all-white outfit.

The TV star is in the British capital to attend the annual Global Gift Gala fundraising event where she serves as an honorary chair alongside fellow actress Melanie Griffith.

The actress looked nothing short of sensational as she left the private members' club, donning a cream knee-length coat with a white turtle-neck jumper

Eva shared a photo of herself on Instagram enjoying coffee with Melanie in the city ahead of the event on Thursday.

'The girls are in London! Watch out,' she captioned the snap.

Proceeds from The Global Gift Gala go to The Global Gift Foundation, a philanthropic non-profit organisation that aims to create a positive impact on the lives of children, women and families around the world.

Eva welcomed her first child, Santiago, with her husband Jose Baston, who is the president of Televisa, the largest media company in Latin America, just over a year ago.

Travel: Eva informed her social media followers she was in London earlier on Tuesday with a blurred snap she posted on Instagram wearing an all-white outfit

The Texas-born beauty tied the knot with the 51-year-old on May 21, 2016 in Mexico after meeting on a blind date set up by a mutual friend.

Eva previously revealed how much motherhood had changed her 'in every way' in an interview with Haute Living.

'Everything is different' she said. 'You're no longer the center of your universe. Now, everything revolves around him and his schedule and his needs - happily so.'

Meanwhile, Eva still has a busy film career. She co-starred in the just released film, Dora And The Lost City Of Gold, as the young explorer's mother, Elena.

Eva is also an executive producer of ABC's Grand Hotel series, which premiered on June 17. She had a guest appearance as Beatriz Mendoza.

Her next project is romantic drama Sylvie about a woman working at her father's record store in Harlem in the late 1950s who meets an aspiring saxophone player and is due for release in 2020.
